metadata.title: CVE-2021-40491 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The ftp client in GNU Inetutils before 2.2 does not validate addressesreturned by PASV/LSPV responses to make sure they match the server address.This is similar to CVE-2020-8284 for curl.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

inetutils-ftp - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-ftpd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-inetd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-ping - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-syslogd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-talk - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-talkd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-telnet - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-telnetd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-tools - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
inetutils-traceroute - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: inetutils package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.2+esm1').
